intro: Cenesmon mairei, commonly known as the Maire's cenesmon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating. Cenesmon mairei is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
